result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Doran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $ 300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges each count.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  State shall have 60 days to determine restitution - jointly and severally with Co-Defendants.  May Not have contact with Jill U or co defendant's unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
Co deft in file 15-CF-222 paid the victim.

timeConds.notes: Huber and Work Crew allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund;gb/jg/bl   ck#16CH076562
Amended  - joint and several
Amended
Restitution ordered in the amount of $880.00
Co deft paid victim.
for Restitution Order filed by ADA Drees
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
For Ct 1 only - Dismissed and read in.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Kevin R Doran, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In.  Counts 2 & 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 4/2/16 at 8:00 AM.  Each count is Concurrent.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized. Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs on both counts.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.   State shall have 60 days to determine Restitution.  Motion to expunge record upon completion of probation is denied by the court.  Appeal Rights given.
From D.A. regarding additional discovery
Amended And demand for discovery - filed by ADA M Drees.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved; DNA results still not received from the state crime lab.  State's verbal motion to sever from co-defendants is granted.  At request of Atty Dress and with no objection by Atty Rose, JSH changed from 3/10/16 to 3/17/16 at 1:00.  JT changed from 3/14/16 to 3/21/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Kevin R Doran, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
DNA samples were recently submitted by parties and case is not resolved at this time.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State. Defendant, Kevin R Doran, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
Parties stipulate to State's motion to compel DE to submit to DNA testing and DE is ordered to complete DNA test between 9/29/15 and 10/2/15 at the PSB.  Atty Wells states the previous DNA evidence has not been received back from the Milwaukee Crime Lab yet.  Final Pre-Trial on 11/6/15 at 11:00 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Kevin R Doran, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Clerk: PT
DNA evidence was sent up to Milwaukee and hasn't came back yet so parties mutually request an adjournment.  FPT on 9/23/15 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-23-15 @ 8:40am with co-def. Bond continued.
